intro: Capsella oelandica, commonly known as the field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters, featuring alternate, pinnately compound leaves with a hairy texture. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
